channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product. E-2023100742-Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report E-2023100699
item.description:
Report E-2023100699

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While a Basin Transportation driver was offloading a tote at the Veolia Henderson site, it was observed that the top secondary bung on the tote was loose and had released liquid during transportation. The release impacted the side of the tote and trailer floor. Veolia employees cleaned up the released material in house. No injuries or exposures.

item.title: Report X-2023101129
item.description:
Report X-2023101129

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A Fully regulated package came to QA wet and soiled after inspection loose and punctured cap/lid caused the spill soiling the box and other contents. DescribePack: punctured lid on the metal drum caused the spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was brought to QA for inspection in a lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023091100
item.description:
Report X-2023091100

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was in hazmat cage when arrived did research and found that 803(DENL) placed inside the cage after 96 them due to it being damaged because they are behind, I did let manager know what happened and I stated I would do Hess report and damage on it. DescribePack: Closures came loose on both bottles and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 13 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was brought to hazmat cage when discovered damage and placed inside a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023091084
item.description:
Report X-2023091084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was been unloaded when the notices something white on the top of lid so they brought the package to QA's cage. QA inspected and analyzed the package and started the process on the package. DescribePack: it failed by the lid/cap of the drum DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was put in a bag and red bucket

item.title: Report X-2023091057
item.description:
Report X-2023091057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment was mistakenly sent up into the sorter instead of going down the IC belt. The facers didn't see it, so the sorter pushed it down a load side chute. That's when the damage was discovered. The damage was called out over the radio and an Admin promptly contained the shipment and took it back to the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: The leakage seems to stem from the lid of one of the four bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Swift action taken by an Admin reduced the release time. Absorbent and PH neutralizer were used to soak up the spill marks on the floor post-discovery.

item.title: Report X-2023091056
item.description:
Report X-2023091056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 9:00pm a trainer who was splitting for vanline three informed me that there were three leaking hazmats. I placed hazmats in a plastic bags/and bins and placed them in QA1. It appears this hazmat leaked on the other two hazmats. DescribePack: The air relief cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and bin.

item.title: Report X-2023091039
item.description:
Report X-2023091039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: COLORADO SPRINGS
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED ON VEHICLE AT DELIVERY LOCATION. DRIVER BAGGED ITEM IN A BLACK PLASTIC BAG FOR SECURITY. PACKAGE INSPECTED 9/22/23 AT BEHEST OF CHARITY DOKES TO ENSURE PROPER PROCESS. DISCOVERED 1 ITEM ENTIRELY EMPTY. DescribePack: 1 BOTTLE LEAKED, CAUSING LEAKAGE ON OTHER ITEMS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BAGGED IN BLACK PLASTIC BAG

item.title: Report X-2023091064

Report X-2023091064

  • City: BROOMFIELD

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During outbound at around 8:15pm an unload manager discovered a wet hazmat. The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag red-tote and stored in QA1. DescribePack: One of the jerricans had a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in plastic bag and red-tote.

item.title: Report X-2023091058
item.description:
Report X-2023091058

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: ENGLEWOOD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A leaking package was found onboard FedEx Ground Trailer # 808405, unload brought the wet box over to qa. DescribePack: The outer box was wet and upon opening the outer box the bag that was holding the bottle was filled with the ether. It was discovered that the cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed into a red hazmat tote and brought over to the QA Cage.
